channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: He spent 20 years in prison for murder. Then someone else confessed to the same crime
item.description: In the fall of 1988, a 13-year-old was raped and murdered in her bed.

item.title: The horrifying reality of Brazil's coronavirus outbreak
item.description: In Brazil's largest and most badly infected city, coronavirus has yet to peak, yet already the healthcare system is crumbling visibly around us. As doctors struggle valiantly to save lives, the country's President, Jair Bolsonaro, seems more focused on another sick patient: his country's economy.

item.title: Pressure mounting on UK PM to sack top aide over 'lockdown breach'
Hong Kong protest over proposed national security law met with tear gas
item.description: Protesters took to the streets of Hong Kong Sunday to oppose the Chinese government's move to impose a controversial national security law, which threatens the city's autonomy and civil liberties.

item.title: Hong Kong lawmaker: Our young are fighting for their future
item.description: Activists in Hong Kong are decrying China's move to pass a hugely controversial national security law for Hong Kong, in what could be the biggest blow to the city's autonomy and civil liberties since its handover to Chinese rule in 1997. CNN's Anna Coren reports.

item.title: Coronavirus is killing more men. But the lockdown is disastrous for women and their rights
item.description: The novel coronavirus seems to be more deadly for men. But in every other way, women are bearing the brunt of this pandemic.

item.title: New York Times publishes names of 1,000 lives lost to coronavirus
item.description: The most important word on the front page of Sunday's New York Times is "incalculable."

item.title: Tiny airport becomes the world's busiest
item.description: Alaska's Anchorage International Airport lacks the waterfalls and razzmatazz of Singapore Changi or the eight runways of Chicago O'Hare.

item.title: Eid al-Fitr: One of the happiest times for Muslims will be a somber affair
item.description: It's no secret that Ramadan this year looked very different for Muslims around the world.

item.title: Kim Jong Un wants to increase North Korea's 'nuclear war deterrence,' state media reports
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un set forth new policies to increase the nation's nuclear deterrence at a meeting of military leaders, state news agency KCNA reported Sunday.

item.title: Report: Brazil's indigenous people are dying at an alarming rate from Covid-19
item.description: Far from hospitals and often lacking basic infrastructure, Brazil's indigenous people are dying at an alarming rate from Covid-19 with little help in sight.

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine trial volunteers speak to CNN
item.description: CNN's Clarissa Ward speaks to participants in a coronavirus human vaccine trial at the University of Oxford.

item.title: San Francisco fire has destroyed a quarter of Pier 45
item.description: More than 125 San Francisco firefighters are battling a four-alarm warehouse fire Saturday on Pier 45, the city's fire department says.

item.title: Beach chaos threatens Europe as temperatures rise
item.description: As summer approaches, temperatures are starting to rise in Europe, and citizens are looking towards their next vacations after months stuck at home under lockdown restrictions.

item.title: White House adviser: China's security law a 'scary move'
item.description: Kevin Hassett, senior economic adviser to President Trump, tells CNN's Poppy Harlow that China's proposed national security law will be "very costly to China and the people of Hong Kong."

item.title: Pakistan plane crash black box found after 97 killed
item.description: Rescue crews have retrieved the data recorder from the Pakistan International Airlines plane that crashed on Friday, killing at least 97 passengers and crew members.

item.title: US successfully tested a laser weapon that can destroy aircraft mid-flight
item.description: A US Navy warship has successfully tested a new high-energy laser weapon that can destroy aircraft mid-flight, the Navy's Pacific Fleet said in a statement Friday.

item.title: Pandemic could reshape the world order
item.description: Europe outright rejected US President Donald Trump's vision of the world this week. Tensions between these historic democratic allies that have been simmering since Trump came to office three years ago have now come to a boil during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Two hairstylists potentially exposed 140 people to coronavirus
item.description: Two Missouri hairstylists potentially exposed 140 clients to coronavirus when they worked for up to eight days this month while symptomatic, health officials said.

item.title: Drone footage captures mass graves dug in Brazil
item.description: CNN's Nick Paton Walsh takes us inside of an ICU in Sao Paulo, Brazil, where medical personnel are struggling to meet the needs of those infected with coronavirus.

item.title: How to stay cool without air conditioning when your house is hot and the outdoors are closed
item.description: Being unable to afford air conditioning or wanting to save more by using it less is a normal circumstance for some of us.

item.title: Businesses fear the worst for Hong Kong's future
item.description: Hong Kong's status as Asia's premiere financial hub survived months of political unrest last year. But news this week that China is planning to further erode the city's autonomy has again called into question its future as an East-West conduit for global business.

item.title: Severe storms, flooding and excessive heat make for a messy Memorial Day weekend
item.description: Memorial Day weekend is in full swing, but if you're planning on going outside you might want to pack a poncho or umbrella. It's going to be a wet one in many areas across the United States.

item.title: A new social movement is helping connect those who need help with those who can help
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has inspired a grassroots movement that is connecting people who need help with donors who can offer financial assistance.

item.title: The Shenzhen effect: Why China's original 'model' city matters more than ever
item.description: By 2035, China's government expects over 70% of the country's population -- around a billion people -- to be living in cities.

item.title: 'Verzuz' has everyone flocking to Instagram. Here's why the weekly battles are such a hit
item.description: Music producers Swizz Beatz and Timbaland created "Verzuz" to bring joy and entertainment to millions of hip-hop and R&B fans stuck indoors due to the coronavirus pandemic. But they may have ended up spawning a new cultural touchstone.

item.title: Biden apologizes for saying black voters torn between him and Trump 'ain't black'
item.description: Joe Biden told a popular African-American radio host Friday morning that anyone struggling to decide whether to support him or President Donald Trump in the general election "ain't black."

item.title: Meet Biscuits and Gravy, the kitten born with two faces
item.description: An Oregon family got quite the surprise when one of their farm cats gave birth to a litter of six kittens, including one twice as cute as the rest.

item.title: Fauci is 'cautiously optimistic' about this finding
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci, a key member of the White House coronavirus task force, explains why he is encouraged by early findings in a recent coronavirus vaccine trial.

item.title: How to help children with ADHD thrive in a virtual schoolhouse
item.description: When schools shut down because of the coronavirus, some parents of children with ADHD found themselves in a stressful predicament.

item.title: Millions of cicadas are expected to emerge after 17 years underground
item.description: As if we didn't have enough to worry about with giant murder hornets invading the US and a global pandemic, millions of 17-year cicadas will emerge from the ground this year.

item.title: Gupta's tips for staying safe before - and during - your flight
item.description: As air travel resumes, CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta demonstrates how to safely navigate the airport and what you should do once you're aboard the plane.

item.title: Lionel Messi and La Liga stars get go ahead to resume play
item.description: Lionel Messi and the other footballing superstars of La Liga have been given the all-clear to take to the field again in the second week of June, Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez announced Saturday.

item.title: Joe Biden gives his thoughts on possible VP
item.description: Presidential candidate Joe Biden appeared on "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert" and the two of them discussed his possible choice for VP.

item.title: Vintage photos show British vacationers gone wild
item.description: Butlin's vacation resorts were an institution in post-war Britain. The self-contained camps -- where guests were housed in wooden chalets, fed and entertained on-site -- provided a new kind of inexpensive luxury for working families.

item.title: Meet the 1-year-old chef with 1.3 followers on Instagram
item.description: A 1-year-old chef is cooking up a storm on social media, with more than a million followers on Instagram tuning in to "Kobe Eats" to enjoy his baby-faced tutorials.

item.title: The extreme team whose death-defying jumps caught the attention of Hollywood
item.description: Jumping between high-rise buildings, launching themselves off cliffs and gliding across rooftops are commonplace for parkour group Storror.

item.title: Legendary NBA coach Jerry Sloan dies at age 78
item.description: Jerry Sloan, the longtime Utah Jazz head coach who led the team to the NBA Finals twice and ranks third among NBA coaches on the all-time wins list, has died. He was 78.

item.title: Crayola unveils new packs of crayons to reflect world's skin tones
item.description: Crayola will release new packs of crayons to represent the world's skin tones, the company revealed Thursday.

item.title: Can you identify the city from its skyline?
item.description: We all know that travel broadens the mind. Thanks to that place on the seafront that sells delicious gelato, it has a tendency to broaden other body parts too.

item.title: $870m 'city' built for online shopping
item.description: Many of us have been forced to take our shopping habits online during lockdown, and while stores have been shuttered, many internet traders are flourishing.

item.title: Kristen Bell gets real about potty training her kids
item.description: Actress Kristen Bell opened up about the differences in potty training her two children on her show "Momsplaining with Kristen Bell."

item.title: Nurse who lost 50 lbs. from virus: I pretty much cried when I looked in the mirror
item.description: CNN's John Berman speaks with Mike Schultz, the San Francisco nurse who shared before and after pictures of himself showing the impact that Covid-19 had on his body.

item.title: When amusement parks reopen, what will it be like?
item.description: Think back to your amusement park adventures in those heady days before the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Bong Joon Ho had a big year. And not just because of 'Parasite'
item.description: Something big happened to Bong Joon Ho last year. Something that had nothing to do with the director's Palme d'Or win for "Parasite," international box office success or becoming an Oscar nominee. Last October, the killer he made a film about nearly two decades ago confessed.

item.title: South Korean man confesses to a series of murders that stumped police for decades
item.description: A South Korean man has confessed to the murder of 14 women including nine who were victims in the country's most infamous serial killing case -- but the suspect won't face prosecution, police said.

item.title: Police say they've identified a suspect in a three-decade-old South Korean serial murder case. But he won't face charges
item.description: Beginning more than three decades ago, 10 women died in a spate of killings in the same South Korean city.

item.title: Matthew McConaughey and Camila Alves are delivering face masks in rural Texas
item.description: Matthew McConaughey and wife, Camila Alves, are hitting the road for a good cause.

item.title: Woman who confessed to killing her 9-year-old son pushed him into a canal in Florida, affidavit says
item.description: A mother who initially told police that her son was abducted in Florida admitted during an interrogation that she led him to a canal -- where the 9-year-old was later found dead, an arrest affidavit says.
